intro: Lachnostylis hirta var. minor, commonly known as the small hairy lachnostylis, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces spatulate leaves that are often covered in fine, short hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
